intro: Erichsenia uncinata, commonly known as the hooked erichsenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its hairy, elongated leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its unique morphology includes hooked bracts that give it its common name. Erichsenia uncinata is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
